manifest.creator: Aaron Halfaker <aaron.halfaker@gmail.com>
manifest.comment: Init with my best understanding of the fields

researchObject.title: Inter-activity times datasets
researchObject.abstract: This article contains a set of datasets used to demonstrate a strong regularity in inter-activity time.

privacyEthics.anonymizedData: All users were randomly sampled from larger datasets.  All user identifiers have been passed through a one-way hashing algorithm with a secret salt
privacyEthics.privacyConsiderations: This dataset contains some data from the infamous AOL dataset.  All of the concerning fields from that dataset have been dropped because they did not serve the intended purposes of this work and would likely cause privacy violations if republished.

provenance.narrative: This dataset was generated by measuring the inter-activity times for a set of users.  The pattern is simple.  1. obtain activities for a user.  2. sort the activities chronologically.  3. measure time between pairs of events for each user.  Specifically, this data was generated using the code in this repo: https://github.com/halfak/Activity-sessions-research.  To re-generate the datasets, you'll be responsible for obtaining the source data from Open Street Map, Movielens, AOL search logs, League of Legends game play events and Wikimedia edit/view logs.  Once this source data is placed into the appropriate directories, the inter-activity time calculations can be started via the Makefile included in the repository.

publications.publication: Halfaker, A., Keyes, O., Kluver, D., Thebault-Spieker, J., Nguyen, T., Shores, K., ... & Warncke-Wang, M. (2015, May). User session identification based on strong regularities in inter-activity time. In Proceedings of the 24th International Conference on World Wide Web (pp. 410-418). International World Wide Web Conferences Steering Committee.

locations.comment: General discussion of activity session measurement using an inter-activity time threshold
